Reviews.Title: “Hotel Buenos Aires”
Reviews.Author: Crenguta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two weeks in October. It was a work travel. The rooms are very clean, all new, although some details need to be finished (in my room the fake ceiling was not finished and I was able to see in the attic). The personnel of the hotel was available and gave me good advises for the restaurants in the area. Near the hotel, there are bus stops for the train station Termini and for the center. Although, the breakfast is very poor and the internet is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of an Archers Direct/Cosmos holiday this has to be the dirtiest hotel we've ever stayed in. The filthy stained reception carpet should have alerted us as to what was to come. Our "clean" room had urine on the toilet, the minibar had hairs in it, and the bedding covered in dubious stains. Our replacement room wasn't much cleaner but it was all that was avaialble. Definately not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: norabaiou
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very unhelpful and especially the manager at the reception. He was uncooperative and did not care about the guests. The only nice and kind person was the luggage handler who had to carry all the suitcases in a tiny lift. We carried our own suitcases to our room as he was struggling with a full coach load of bags and suitcases. Wifi was charged at 5 Euro per hour and when we asked to get only 30 minutes, the manager answered that the hotel wasn't offering the option. We found this attitude very upsetting, especially in the heart of Europe and with the prices being charged for the rooms! Breakfast was of mediocre quality and one lady kept watching clients helping themselves to the food, just in case they were taking a piece of bread or a bun with them to eat later. She kept staring at clients and at the food on their tables obsessively. This attitude was extremely annoying as they did not seem to care about customers’ satisfaction but more about the quantity of the poor quality food being eaten or taken away. Personally, I would recommend to avoid this hotel until the managment understands that guests should be treated nicely and changes its attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: cluffne
Reviews.Content: Rooms 101 and 303 were of acceptable size, not to large, but comfortable. Wifi available - at a steep cost. We asked staff for local resturants, and were directed to the "sister company" resturant. We discovered later, there are bars and shops, along with a supermarket only 2 streets away. Most staff were helpful, but relectant to really assist. Breakfast was cereal, meats cheese, bread and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing!”
Reviews.Author: MCLUSA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel as well as its sister hotel about 100yds away and had a great experience. The rooms were recently renovated and, although not huge (obviously, since this is Europe we're talking about), are very comfortable. But what's really great is the location - at first glance it might seem "suburban", but I found that this was actually a good thing when I realized how chaotic Rome is inside the walls - the couple of minutes more it took me to get back to the hotel was well worth the good night's sleep. With a little guidance from the hotel staff, I found that the neighborhood restaurants (mostly hidden, all full of Italians and thus good food, and none with the obnoxious guy standing outside trying to pull you in as you too often find near all the tourist attractions) were quite nice. There are buses to get to the tourist areas, but you can also just walk in (less than 15 minutes to get into the Via Veneto area inside the roman walls). As a runner, I was also happy to find that there were two parks nearby (Villa Borghese and Villa Ada), so I even managed to get in a morning run. Staff was friendly, the hotel was clean, and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “alright hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: kna_nz
Reviews.Content: On our arrival to Buenos Aires we received a cold greeting from a blonde woman at reception. She told us we were staying in their ‘sister hotel’ for the first night of our stay. Why? We were not told, she did not offer an explanation. When we asked she just brushed it off saying it was just for the first night of our stay and didn’t elaborate any further. After 36 hours of flying, transit, and transportation, we didn’t push the matter, we just wanted to get to whatever hotel room they had for us, freshen up and rest. She said it was ‘just along the road up there’ and pointed in the direction of. We asked if it would be hard to find or if she could show us on a map but she insisted no, that it was just that way and if we went that way we would find it. Fortunately it was just at the end of the road and around the corner, so it was easy to find… but when asking her we didn’t know this and it may have been courteous to show us on a map just to humour us or to explain to us just how easy it really would be to find. So without explanation of why we had been put in a different hotel to that which we had booked… and with minimal directions as to where we were going, we lugged our bags up the road in hope the ‘sister hotel’ we had been shunted out to wasn’t too far. To our satisfaction it was a five minute walk to the end of the street, turn left, cross the road and we were there. The following day our bags were transferred from the ‘sister hotel’ back to Hotel Buenos Aires where we collected them at reception and checked in to our room there. We took our own bags up the stairs – our preference to using tiny worn out little lifts – and into our room. Nice décor and bathroom, though this hotel room was very small. You could edge your way sideways around the bed, between the bed and the desk and into the bathroom. There was enough room for one person to stand in the bathroom at a time, and a little room behind the door to the room when it was closed, which we had to make use of for our bags. The bed was hard, but we still managed good night’s sleep. The shower was very good and the overall cleanliness of the room was good too. When we went down for breakfast in the morning a brunette woman come through the breakfast room telling everyone in there to get out that breakfast wasn’t starting until fifteen minutes later, there had been a mistake and obviously one of the staff had opened the breakfast room early or something had gone wrong somewhere along the line, she come through waving her arms and with minimal English saying people weren’t welcome in there yet etc, but people had already filled their plates, sat down and began to eat. You would think by then the staff would just work around the problem without being rude to the guests like so, but obviously that was not her thinking. We had booked to return to this hotel again a couple of weeks later on a return to Rome during our stay in Italy. When we returned we encountered another room of the same standard as the first, equally as small but with pleasant décor and it was nice and clean. The second visit we dealt with two different male staff at reception who were much more pleasant to deal with than the two women we encountered on our first visit. In short Hotel Buenos Aires has small rooms with nice décor and a good standard of cleanliness. The standard of customer service is changeable by the staff member, sometimes quite cold and unhelpful, others quite pleasant. The hotel itself is about a 40 minute walk from The Spanish Steps, Trinita Dei Monti, Keats Shelley Memorial House Museum, Trevi Fountain, and about 20 minutes to Villa Borghese and Museo de Villa Borghese. There is a supermarket five minutes walking distance from the hotel which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 806!”
Reviews.Author: davidn59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, at the start and finish of a Cosmos tour in August 2010. The first room was good, large and comfortable. The second time we were in Room 806. AVOID THIS ROOM IF AT ALL POSSIBLE! It was very, very small, which you may be able to cope with. But the double bed is uncomfortable even to look at, with the mattress curling into a huge valley down the middle. Lying on the bed does not improve the situation. Diabolical! Internet is expensive and only works from a public location in a corridor, not in individual rooms. There is a supermarket about five minutes walk away. Ask the staff where it is. They didn’t tell us when we asked about food options in the area. On a Sunday afternoon there is not much else around.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: marianna1977
Reviews.Content: hotel room very small but that came to be expected the longer I was in europe, the hotel is in a nice area but far removed from most attractions in rome, breakfast was ok but eggs were not real eggs, service was just ok, elevator and shower is very very small....

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: PrincePolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely off the beaten track but with good public transport connections (buses) to the central train station. A taxi to/from the airport (Fiumicino) takes over an hour, if there is no traffic. I had a meeting nearby, so the location was perfect for me. The room was clean and adequately decorated for the hotel class. At the front desk I bought a voucher for 1 hour of WiFi access but when I tried to connect in my room, the connection speed was too slow to download even smallest emails. I complained and got a refund without any hassle. The breakfast was a bit of strange experience – I walked into a small, crowded breakfast room where only coffee, rolls, butter, and jelly were on offer. I was somewhat disappointed but soon discovered that I was in the breakfast room for groups! In the adjacent room, behind a frosted glass door, a very decent breakfast was on offer to individual guests. I moved there and once a server verified that I was in fact an individual guest I was able to enjoy a nice continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, poor quality food”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaw14
Reviews.Content: One small lift, hot water service continually breaks down, poor customer service from staff, dining room crowded, got to be there early to get in quick and find a seat and then get food otherwise you miss out. Only good thing is it's not far from transport to centre and the Hotel Business cards have map and list of buses that pass by. Buy some quick snacks before you get there from Venice (if on Cosmos tour) have these for breakfast, and get out of hotel as quick as possible. Tours end up here on Saturday, just remeber rest of area doesn't come awake on Sunday till after 10.30am.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about the lifts”
Reviews.Author: subyrv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Cosmos Tour. The rooms were clean, about the same size as most european hotels. Don't bother using the lifts. We walked up the stairs to the 3rd floor at the same time our friends got in the lift to go to the second floor. We walked to the 2nd floor and waited at least a minute for the lift to arrive. There is only 1 lift and only about 4 people fit in, so the poor porter had a terrible time with all the bags. The breakfast was nice, but the breakfast room was SO SO small. Cost approx 9 euros in a taxi to get from the centre of Rome to the hotel so not too bad distance wise from Rome, but the area it is in is a bit seedy. The hotel has wifi, but you can't access it from your room so have to sit in the hotel lobby. Service in the bar, there was a guy who turned up occasionally, who couldn't speak much english and served me a glass of wine in a water glass....

Reviews.Title: “Great room, awful breakfast service.”
Reviews.Author: brilliantone63
Reviews.Content: Buenos Aires Hotel had a pretty good room and bathroom. Elevator took some time, so if you're on the first and second floors I recommend the stairs (unless of course you're carrying luggage). But the hotel has no restaurant facilities. Breakfast was part of our tour package,so the hotel served it,but it was a terrible experience. The place was cramped, food was all cold (inlcuding the eggs), and if you weren't in the first batch, you would have to wait a good 20 minutes for the food to get refilled. Oh,and if you're a tea drinker? Forget it. They don't serve tea.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better ...”
Reviews.Author: RWRB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are travelling round Europe and looking mainly for reasonable / budget accomodation. Given Rome's reputation, we decided to trade up a little to ensure we got a decent / safe hotel. Room was very very small and bed was a regular double (i.e. tiny) , but it sufficed, just ,and had a safe and a/c (which also just managed to do the job). Staff were friendly, spoke good english and tried to help, but some did not really have a great grasp of what to do. A simple buffet breakfast was also included. Area location is good (supermarket, botuique shops, restaurants etc) and bus stop very nearby with regular buses to the main areas / Termini station (which took 10 - 20 mins) Hotel claimed it had wi-fi, but it was not working and was expensive, otherwise there is a single internet terminal (also not working). Rooms and decor (apart from main lobby) felt they needed a facelift and although we had a smoking room (had requested non-smoking), we did not expect the cleaner to be smoking in it whilst she cleaned! All in all it was a dissapointing experience, at £50 pn, this was an 'upgrade' on our normal budget and even thought it was Rome in August, the hotel is in a suburb and so we really expected a little more overall professionalism ... The hotel semed to have a steady trade from Cosmos (?) tours, which may explain their lack have having to really try ...

Reviews.Title: “Peace & quite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: oldgrumps000
Reviews.Content: Like your previous reveiw of this hotel , my wife & I were on a Cosmos tour and stayed two nights. We found the hotel very comfoertable and the rooms wre in a refurbished condition. As you know hotel rooms in Europe are prety small, this was no exception but the bonus was a good size shower where you could bend over to retreive the soap off the floor without stepping out of the shower. Our room had a LCD Television screen which was good for watching the World Cup at night. Dining room pretty pokey but breakfast was alright (for Italy). Plenty of eating outlets and internet cafe 2 blocks away. Would recommend, hope to return next year myself and will check out price.

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bathroom floods, bed is very hard and you should ask for a room on second floor. Kinda far from everything

Reviews.Title: “Faraway from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a Cosmos tour around Europe. The place we were put up at was this hotel. Making a comparison with other hotels during our trip, it was one of the worst. This hotel was way far from the city centre and from anything else. The bathroom was also tiny. One would not wish to drop your soap whilst being in it!! The sheets still had human hairs in them!! This is despite the house keeping staff advising us the room has been serviced. Finally when we were showering, if anyone else showered too, the hot water pressure was so affected, it meant a fluatuating temperature shower for us!! From cold to scotching hot! There are many other budget hotels than this one, for the same price.

HotelInfo.Name: Buenos Aires
HotelInfo.Address: Via Clitunno 9, 00198 Rome, Italy
